support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with Alsin, a protein linked to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and other motor neuron diseases, indicating a potential role in shared pathogenic mechanisms.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with Alsin (ALS2), a protein linked to several forms of juvenile-onset motor neuron diseases, including amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
functions.effect_description: This interaction points to a potential overlap in the molecular pathways underlying spinocerebellar ataxia and motor neuron diseases. The functional significance of this interaction is not yet fully elucidated but may involve shared mechanisms of protein quality control or cytoskeletal dynamics.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 interacts with Alsin → Involvement in shared neurodegenerative pathways → Potential for common therapeutic targets

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with Alsin (ALS2), a protein linked to several forms of juvenile-onset motor neuron diseases, including amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
effect: This interaction points to a potential overlap in the molecular pathways underlying spinocerebellar ataxia and motor neuron diseases. The functional significance of this interaction is not yet fully elucidated but may involve shared mechanisms of protein quality control or cytoskeletal dynamics.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with Alsin to modulate neurodegenerative disease pathways, ultimately affecting potential for common therapeutic targets.
